segments.text: I see the woman so absorbed in her task, blissfully unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water spills over the sink, forming a puddle, but she just keeps polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a sense of dread; the floor is becoming a slippery trap.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t she just take a moment to notice what’s happening?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are on the verge of mischief, and it’s almost funny in its innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy, reaching for those cookies, looks so determined; it’s almost admirable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice how precariously he's balanced on that stool—he could fall at any second.
segments.speaker: PAR
